newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: ARA bunkers calm after stormy fluctuations.
newsitem.headline: ARA bunkers calm after stormy fluctuations.

text.p: After a week of wild daily fluctuations ARA fuel oil bunkers were broadly steady on Wednesday, with little change elsewhere in Europe, dealers said.

Rotterdam 380 CST was quoted at $98/100 fob after one U.S. trading house sold into the barge market at around $97/$98 fob ARA. Traders said another trading house was rumoured bidding up the market late in the day.
Enquiries increased slowly through the day, but the total traded volume was not large.
"Rotterdam is not the cheapest. The U.S. Gulf looks better for buyers. Suez is not a bad alternative," one trader said.
Hamburg prices were also little changed. Traded volume was very low.
Traders said buyers were more encouraged by Rotterdam prices and Germany would probably have to fall in line.
Mediterranean prices were also steady. Volumes in most locations were low, although buyers in Spain launched a few enquiries.
